canonical_structure.name: UBX-CFG-OTP
canonical_structure.description: Writes the configuration data (key ID and value) for one or more configuration items to the OTP memory.

fields.name: cfgHeader
fields.description: File header: use u-center tool to compose the message

issues: Uses a repeated group for cfgData which is structurally valid but less standard for this binary blob
Confused UBX-CFG-OTP (0x06 0x41) with UBX-CFG-CFG (0x06 0x09). The fields extracted (clearMask, saveMask, loadMask) belong to the configuration management message, not the OTP write message.

adjudication.reasoning: Across all major u-blox documentation, UBX-CFG-OTP (0x06 0x41) is consistently defined as a message consisting of a 12-byte header followed by an arbitrary length of configuration data. Extraction 7 is a clear error where the LLM associated the ID 0x06 0x41 with the payload structure of the common UBX-CFG-CFG message. The description 'Write file 0xA4' found in some extractions refers to the internal filesystem index for OTP, which is consistent with the 'Writes to OTP' description in others.
